term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - stoichiometric number, ν
term.title: stoichiometric number

item.text: A chemical reaction of known stoichiometry can be written in general as: aA + bB + ... → ... + yY + zZ and z are known as the stoichiometric numbers, ν Y and ν Z, for Y and Z respectively. For the reactants the stoichiometric numbers are the negatives of the numbers appearing in the equation; for example the stoichiometric number ν A for the reactant A is -a. In other words, the stoichiometric numbers are positive for products and negative for reactants.
